p: Species distribution modeling (SDM) is widely used in ecology, biogeography, and evolutionary studies [ 7]. In recent years, SDM using Maxent method has contributed significantly to the prediction of biodiversity loss under future climate scenarios [ 8] and to the rational use of environmental resources [ 9] threatened by upcoming climate changes. Importantly, Maxent is able to function with presence-only data, such as those of speciesâ€™ distribution records. It requires only geo-referenced occurrence data to predict the distribution of suitable habitat for a species through determinations of the probability distribution of maximum entropy [ 10] coupled with environmental information for the whole study area.
